org.jpws.pwslib.data

Interface PwsBlockOutputStream


  • public interface PwsBlockOutputStream
    Interface defines a low-level write streaming device for data blocks of a fixed length. Depending on the technology used in the linked PWS file, blocksize may vary.

    A PwsBlockOutputStream always refers to an encryption process executed for a target PWS file. The blocks written are the data segments defined by the underlying encryption algorithm valid for a target PWS file.

    • Method Summary

      Modifier and Type Method and Description

      Closes this output stream and writes any remaining data to the underlying data stream.

    • Method Detail

      • getCount

        int getCount()
        The number of written blocks in this output stream.
        Returns:
        int number of blocks (0 means new stream)

      • isClosed

        boolean isClosed()
        Whether this stream is closed.

      • getBlockSize

        int getBlockSize()
        The data blocksize of this stream.

      • writeBlocks

        void writeBlocks(byte[] data)
                 throws java.io.IOException
        Accepts a cleartext data block and writes it encrypted to the underlying output stream. (Parameter data not altered.) If the given block is shorter than an integer multiple of the stream's blocksize, sufficient zero bytes are appended to the user data to form a block of required length.
        Parameters:
        data - byte[] cleartext data
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException

      • writeBlocks

        void writeBlocks(byte[] data,
               int offset,
               int length)
                 throws java.io.IOException
        Accepts a cleartext data block and writes it encrypted to the underlying output stream. (Parameter data not altered.) If the given data segment is shorter than an integer multiple of the stream's blocksize, sufficient zero bytes are appended to the user data to form a block of required length.
        Parameters:
        data - byte[] cleartext data buffer
        offset - int, start offset in buffer
        length - int, length of data segment to write
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException

      • close

        void close()
           throws java.io.IOException
        Closes this output stream and writes any remaining data to the underlying data stream. After close no more data may be written to this stream. Does not close the underlying output stream!
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException
